parameters.name: FlowArn
parameters.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the flow that you want to update.

parameters.name: SourceFailoverConfig
parameters.description: The settings for source failover. FailoverMode (string) --- The type of failover you choose for this flow. MERGE combines the source streams into a single stream, allowing graceful recovery from any single-source loss. FAILOVER allows switching between different streams. RecoveryWindow (integer) --- Recovery window time to look for dash-7 packets. SourcePriority (dict) --- The priority you want to assign to a source. You can have a primary stream and a backup stream or two equally prioritized streams. PrimarySource (string) --- The name of the source you choose as the primary source for this flow. State (string) --- The state of source failover on the flow. If the state is inactive, the flow can have only one source. If the state is active, the flow can have one or two sources.

nested_params.name: FailoverMode
nested_params.description: The type of failover you choose for this flow. MERGE combines the source streams into a single stream, allowing graceful recovery from any single-source loss. FAILOVER allows switching between different streams.

nested_params.name: RecoveryWindow
nested_params.description: Recovery window time to look for dash-7 packets.

nested_params.name: SourcePriority
nested_params.description: The priority you want to assign to a source. You can have a primary stream and a backup stream or two equally prioritized streams.

nested_params.name: PrimarySource
nested_params.description: The name of the source you choose as the primary source for this flow.

nested_params.name: State
nested_params.description: The state of source failover on the flow. If the state is inactive, the flow can have only one source. If the state is active, the flow can have one or two sources.

parameters.name: Maintenance
parameters.description: The maintenance setting of the flow. MaintenanceDay (string) --- A day of a week when the maintenance will happen. MaintenanceScheduledDate (string) --- A scheduled date in ISO UTC format when the maintenance will happen. Use YYYY-MM-DD format. Example: 2021-01-30. MaintenanceStartHour (string) --- UTC time when the maintenance will happen. Use 24-hour HH:MM format. Minutes must be 00. Example: 13:00. The default value is 02:00.

nested_params.name: MaintenanceDay
nested_params.description: A day of a week when the maintenance will happen.

nested_params.name: MaintenanceScheduledDate
nested_params.description: A scheduled date in ISO UTC format when the maintenance will happen. Use YYYY-MM-DD format. Example: 2021-01-30.

nested_params.name: MaintenanceStartHour
nested_params.description: UTC time when the maintenance will happen. Use 24-hour HH:MM format. Minutes must be 00. Example: 13:00. The default value is 02:00.

parameters.name: SourceMonitoringConfig
parameters.description: The settings for source monitoring. ThumbnailState (string) --- Indicates whether thumbnails are enabled or disabled. AudioMonitoringSettings (list) --- Contains the settings for audio stream metrics monitoring. (dict) --- Specifies the configuration for audio stream metrics monitoring. SilentAudio (dict) --- Detects periods of silence. State (string) --- Indicates whether the SilentAudio metric is enabled or disabled. ThresholdSeconds (integer) --- Specifies the number of consecutive seconds of silence that triggers an event or alert. ContentQualityAnalysisState (string) --- Indicates whether content quality analysis is enabled or disabled. VideoMonitoringSettings (list) --- Contains the settings for video stream metrics monitoring. (dict) --- Specifies the configuration for video stream metrics monitoring. BlackFrames (dict) --- Detects video frames that are black. State (string) --- Indicates whether the BlackFrames metric is enabled or disabled.. ThresholdSeconds (integer) --- Specifies the number of consecutive seconds of black frames that triggers an event or alert. FrozenFrames (dict) --- Detects video frames that have not changed. State (string) --- Indicates whether the FrozenFrames metric is enabled or disabled. ThresholdSeconds (integer) --- Specifies the number of consecutive seconds of a static image that triggers an event or alert.

nested_params.name: ThumbnailState
nested_params.description: Indicates whether thumbnails are enabled or disabled.

nested_params.name: AudioMonitoringSettings
nested_params.description: Contains the settings for audio stream metrics monitoring.

nested_params.name: SilentAudio
nested_params.description: Detects periods of silence.

nested_params.name: State
nested_params.description: Indicates whether the SilentAudio metric is enabled or disabled.

nested_params.name: ThresholdSeconds
nested_params.description: Specifies the number of consecutive seconds of silence that triggers an event or alert.

nested_params.name: ContentQualityAnalysisState
nested_params.description: Indicates whether content quality analysis is enabled or disabled.

nested_params.name: VideoMonitoringSettings
nested_params.description: Contains the settings for video stream metrics monitoring.

nested_params.name: BlackFrames
nested_params.description: Detects video frames that are black.

nested_params.name: State
nested_params.description: Indicates whether the BlackFrames metric is enabled or disabled..

nested_params.name: ThresholdSeconds
nested_params.description: Specifies the number of consecutive seconds of black frames that triggers an event or alert.

nested_params.name: FrozenFrames
nested_params.description: Detects video frames that have not changed.

nested_params.name: State
nested_params.description: Indicates whether the FrozenFrames metric is enabled or disabled.

nested_params.name: ThresholdSeconds
nested_params.description: Specifies the number of consecutive seconds of a static image that triggers an event or alert.

parameters.name: NdiConfig
parameters.description: Specifies the configuration settings for NDI outputs. Required when the flow includes NDI outputs. NdiState (string) --- A setting that controls whether NDI outputs can be used in the flow. Must be ENABLED to add NDI outputs. Default is DISABLED. MachineName (string) --- A prefix for the names of the NDI sources that the flow creates. If a custom name isn't specified, MediaConnect generates a unique 12-character ID as the prefix. NdiDiscoveryServers (list) --- A list of up to three NDI discovery server configurations. While not required by the API, this configuration is necessary for NDI functionality to work properly. (dict) --- Specifies the configuration settings for individual NDI discovery servers. A maximum of 3 servers is allowed. The unique network address of the NDI discovery server. DiscoveryServerPort (integer) --- The port for the NDI discovery server. Defaults to 5959 if a custom port isn't specified. The identifier for the Virtual Private Cloud (VPC) network interface used by the flow.

nested_params.name: NdiState
nested_params.description: A setting that controls whether NDI outputs can be used in the flow. Must be ENABLED to add NDI outputs. Default is DISABLED.

nested_params.name: MachineName
nested_params.description: A prefix for the names of the NDI sources that the flow creates. If a custom name isn't specified, MediaConnect generates a unique 12-character ID as the prefix.

nested_params.name: NdiDiscoveryServers
nested_params.description: A list of up to three NDI discovery server configurations. While not required by the API, this configuration is necessary for NDI functionality to work properly.

nested_params.name: DiscoveryServerAddress
nested_params.description: The unique network address of the NDI discovery server.

nested_params.name: DiscoveryServerPort
nested_params.description: The port for the NDI discovery server. Defaults to 5959 if a custom port isn't specified.

nested_params.name: VpcInterfaceAdapter
nested_params.description: The identifier for the Virtual Private Cloud (VPC) network interface used by the flow.

nested_items.name: AvailabilityZone
nested_items.description: The Availability Zone that you want to create the flow in. These options are limited to the Availability Zones within the current Amazon Web Services Region.

nested_items.name: Description
nested_items.description: A description of the flow. This value is not used or seen outside of the current MediaConnect account.

nested_items.name: EgressIp
nested_items.description: The IP address from which video will be sent to output destinations.

nested_items.name: Entitlements
nested_items.description: The entitlements in this flow.

nested_items.name: DataTransferSubscriberFeePercent
nested_items.description: Percentage from 0-100 of the data transfer cost to be billed to the subscriber.

nested_items.name: Description
nested_items.description: A description of the entitlement.

nested_items.name: Encryption
nested_items.description: The type of encryption that will be used on the output that is associated with this entitlement.

nested_items.name: Algorithm
nested_items.description: The type of algorithm that is used for the encryption (such as aes128, aes192, or aes256).

nested_items.name: ConstantInitializationVector
nested_items.description: A 128-bit, 16-byte hex value represented by a 32-character string, to be used with the key for encrypting content. This parameter is not valid for static key encryption.

nested_items.name: DeviceId
nested_items.description: The value of one of the devices that you configured with your digital rights management (DRM) platform key provider. This parameter is required for SPEKE encryption and is not valid for static key encryption.

nested_items.name: KeyType
nested_items.description: The type of key that is used for the encryption. If no keyType is provided, the service will use the default setting (static-key).

nested_items.name: Region
nested_items.description: The Amazon Web Services Region that the API Gateway proxy endpoint was created in. This parameter is required for SPEKE encryption and is not valid for static key encryption.

nested_items.name: ResourceId
nested_items.description: An identifier for the content. The service sends this value to the key server to identify the current endpoint. The resource ID is also known as the content ID. This parameter is required for SPEKE encryption and is not valid for static key encryption.

nested_items.name: RoleArn
nested_items.description: The ARN of the role that you created during setup (when you set up MediaConnect as a trusted entity).

nested_items.name: SecretArn
nested_items.description: The ARN of the secret that you created in Secrets Manager to store the encryption key. This parameter is required for static key encryption and is not valid for SPEKE encryption.

nested_items.name: Url
nested_items.description: The URL from the API Gateway proxy that you set up to talk to your key server. This parameter is required for SPEKE encryption and is not valid for static key encryption.

nested_items.name: EntitlementArn
nested_items.description: The ARN of the entitlement.

nested_items.name: EntitlementStatus
nested_items.description: An indication of whether the entitlement is enabled.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The name of the entitlement.

nested_items.name: Subscribers
nested_items.description: The Amazon Web Services account IDs that you want to share your content with. The receiving accounts (subscribers) will be allowed to create their own flow using your content as the source.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: FlowArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the flow.

nested_items.name: MediaStreams
nested_items.description: The media streams that are associated with the flow. After you associate a media stream with a source, you can also associate it with outputs on the flow.

nested_items.name: Attributes
nested_items.description: Attributes that are related to the media stream.

nested_items.name: ChannelOrder
nested_items.description: The format of the audio channel.

nested_items.name: Colorimetry
nested_items.description: The format used for the representation of color.

nested_items.name: ExactFramerate
nested_items.description: The frame rate for the video stream, in frames/second. For example: 60000/1001.

nested_items.name: Par
nested_items.description: The pixel aspect ratio (PAR) of the video.

nested_items.name: Range
nested_items.description: The encoding range of the video.

nested_items.name: ScanMode
nested_items.description: The type of compression that was used to smooth the video's appearance.

nested_items.name: Tcs
nested_items.description: The transfer characteristic system (TCS) that is used in the video.

nested_items.name: Lang
nested_items.description: The audio language, in a format that is recognized by the receiver.

nested_items.name: ClockRate
nested_items.description: The sample rate for the stream. This value is measured in Hz.

nested_items.name: Description
nested_items.description: A description that can help you quickly identify what your media stream is used for.

nested_items.name: Fmt
nested_items.description: The format type number (sometimes referred to as RTP payload type) of the media stream. MediaConnect assigns this value to the media stream. For ST 2110 JPEG XS outputs, you need to provide this value to the receiver.

nested_items.name: MediaStreamId
nested_items.description: A unique identifier for the media stream.

nested_items.name: MediaStreamName
nested_items.description: A name that helps you distinguish one media stream from another.

nested_items.name: MediaStreamType
nested_items.description: The type of media stream.

nested_items.name: VideoFormat
nested_items.description: The resolution of the video.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The name of the flow.

nested_items.name: Outputs
nested_items.description: The outputs in this flow.

nested_items.name: DataTransferSubscriberFeePercent
nested_items.description: Percentage from 0-100 of the data transfer cost to be billed to the subscriber.

nested_items.name: Description
nested_items.description: A description of the output.

nested_items.name: Destination
nested_items.description: The address where you want to send the output.

nested_items.name: Encryption
nested_items.description: The type of key used for the encryption. If no keyType is provided, the service will use the default setting (static-key).

nested_items.name: Algorithm
nested_items.description: The type of algorithm that is used for the encryption (such as aes128, aes192, or aes256).

nested_items.name: ConstantInitializationVector
nested_items.description: A 128-bit, 16-byte hex value represented by a 32-character string, to be used with the key for encrypting content. This parameter is not valid for static key encryption.

nested_items.name: DeviceId
nested_items.description: The value of one of the devices that you configured with your digital rights management (DRM) platform key provider. This parameter is required for SPEKE encryption and is not valid for static key encryption.

nested_items.name: KeyType
nested_items.description: The type of key that is used for the encryption. If no keyType is provided, the service will use the default setting (static-key).

nested_items.name: Region
nested_items.description: The Amazon Web Services Region that the API Gateway proxy endpoint was created in. This parameter is required for SPEKE encryption and is not valid for static key encryption.

nested_items.name: ResourceId
nested_items.description: An identifier for the content. The service sends this value to the key server to identify the current endpoint. The resource ID is also known as the content ID. This parameter is required for SPEKE encryption and is not valid for static key encryption.

nested_items.name: RoleArn
nested_items.description: The ARN of the role that you created during setup (when you set up MediaConnect as a trusted entity).

nested_items.name: SecretArn
nested_items.description: The ARN of the secret that you created in Secrets Manager to store the encryption key. This parameter is required for static key encryption and is not valid for SPEKE encryption.

nested_items.name: Url
nested_items.description: The URL from the API Gateway proxy that you set up to talk to your key server. This parameter is required for SPEKE encryption and is not valid for static key encryption.

nested_items.name: EntitlementArn
nested_items.description: The ARN of the entitlement on the originator''s flow. This value is relevant only on entitled flows.

nested_items.name: ListenerAddress
nested_items.description: The IP address that the receiver requires in order to establish a connection with the flow. For public networking, the ListenerAddress is represented by the elastic IP address of the flow. For private networking, the ListenerAddress is represented by the elastic network interface IP address of the VPC. This field applies only to outputs that use the Zixi pull or SRT listener protocol.

nested_items.name: MediaLiveInputArn
nested_items.description: The input ARN of the MediaLive channel. This parameter is relevant only for outputs that were added by creating a MediaLive input.

nested_items.name: MediaStreamOutputConfigurations
nested_items.description: The configuration for each media stream that is associated with the output.

nested_items.name: DestinationConfigurations
nested_items.description: The transport parameters that are associated with each outbound media stream.

nested_items.name: DestinationIp
nested_items.description: The IP address where you want MediaConnect to send contents of the media stream.

nested_items.name: DestinationPort
nested_items.description: The port that you want MediaConnect to use when it distributes the media stream to the output.

nested_items.name: Interface
nested_items.description: The VPC interface that you want to use for the media stream associated with the output.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The name of the VPC interface.

nested_items.name: OutboundIp
nested_items.description: The IP address that the receiver requires in order to establish a connection with the flow. This value is represented by the elastic network interface IP address of the VPC. This field applies only to outputs that use the CDI or ST 2110 JPEG XS or protocol.

nested_items.name: EncodingName
nested_items.description: The format that was used to encode the data. For ancillary data streams, set the encoding name to smpte291. For audio streams, set the encoding name to pcm. For video, 2110 streams, set the encoding name to raw. For video, JPEG XS streams, set the encoding name to jxsv.

nested_items.name: EncodingParameters
nested_items.description: A collection of parameters that determine how MediaConnect will convert the content. These fields only apply to outputs on flows that have a CDI source.

nested_items.name: CompressionFactor
nested_items.description: A value that is used to calculate compression for an output. The bitrate of the output is calculated as follows: Output bitrate = (1 / compressionFactor) * (source bitrate) This property only applies to outputs that use the ST 2110 JPEG XS protocol, with a flow source that uses the CDI protocol. Valid values are floating point numbers in the range of 3.0 to 10.0, inclusive.

nested_items.name: EncoderProfile
nested_items.description: A setting on the encoder that drives compression settings. This property only applies to video media streams associated with outputs that use the ST 2110 JPEG XS protocol, with a flow source that uses the CDI protocol.

nested_items.name: MediaStreamName
nested_items.description: The name of the media stream.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The name of the output. This value must be unique within the current flow.

nested_items.name: OutputArn
nested_items.description: The ARN of the output.

nested_items.name: Port
nested_items.description: The port to use when content is distributed to this output.

nested_items.name: Transport
nested_items.description: Attributes related to the transport stream that are used in the output.

nested_items.name: CidrAllowList
nested_items.description: The range of IP addresses that should be allowed to initiate output requests to this flow. These IP addresses should be in the form of a Classless Inter-Domain Routing (CIDR) block; for example, 10.0.0.0/16
(string) ---

nested_items.name: MaxBitrate
nested_items.description: The smoothing max bitrate (in bps) for RIST, RTP, and RTP-FEC streams.

nested_items.name: MaxLatency
nested_items.description: The maximum latency in milliseconds. This parameter applies only to RIST-based and Zixi-based streams.

nested_items.name: MaxSyncBuffer
nested_items.description: The size of the buffer (in milliseconds) to use to sync incoming source data.

nested_items.name: MinLatency
nested_items.description: The minimum latency in milliseconds for SRT-based streams. In streams that use the SRT protocol, this value that you set on your MediaConnect source or output represents the minimal potential latency of that connection. The latency of the stream is set to the highest number between the sender's minimum latency and the receiver's minimum latency.

nested_items.name: Protocol
nested_items.description: The protocol that is used by the source or output.

nested_items.name: RemoteId
nested_items.description: The remote ID for the Zixi-pull stream.

nested_items.name: SenderControlPort
nested_items.description: The port that the flow uses to send outbound requests to initiate connection with the sender.

nested_items.name: SenderIpAddress
nested_items.description: The IP address that the flow communicates with to initiate connection with the sender.

nested_items.name: SmoothingLatency
nested_items.description: The smoothing latency in milliseconds for RIST, RTP, and RTP-FEC streams.

nested_items.name: SourceListenerAddress
nested_items.description: Source IP or domain name for SRT-caller protocol.

nested_items.name: SourceListenerPort
nested_items.description: Source port for SRT-caller protocol.

nested_items.name: StreamId
nested_items.description: The stream ID that you want to use for this transport. This parameter applies only to Zixi and SRT caller-based streams.

nested_items.name: NdiSpeedHqQuality
nested_items.description: A quality setting for the NDI Speed HQ encoder.

nested_items.name: NdiProgramName
nested_items.description: A suffix for the names of the NDI sources that the flow creates. If a custom name isn't specified, MediaConnect uses the output name.

nested_items.name: VpcInterfaceAttachment
nested_items.description: The name of the VPC interface attachment to use for this output.

nested_items.name: VpcInterfaceName
nested_items.description: The name of the VPC interface to use for this resource.

nested_items.name: BridgeArn
nested_items.description: The ARN of the bridge added to this output.

nested_items.name: BridgePorts
nested_items.description: The bridge output ports currently in use.
(integer) ---

nested_items.name: OutputStatus
nested_items.description: An indication of whether the output is transmitting data or not.

nested_items.name: PeerIpAddress
nested_items.description: The IP address of the device that is currently receiving content from this output.

nested_items.name: DataTransferSubscriberFeePercent
nested_items.description: Percentage from 0-100 of the data transfer cost to be billed to the subscriber.

nested_items.name: Decryption
nested_items.description: The type of encryption that is used on the content ingested from this source.

nested_items.name: Algorithm
nested_items.description: The type of algorithm that is used for the encryption (such as aes128, aes192, or aes256).

nested_items.name: ConstantInitializationVector
nested_items.description: A 128-bit, 16-byte hex value represented by a 32-character string, to be used with the key for encrypting content. This parameter is not valid for static key encryption.

nested_items.name: DeviceId
nested_items.description: The value of one of the devices that you configured with your digital rights management (DRM) platform key provider. This parameter is required for SPEKE encryption and is not valid for static key encryption.

nested_items.name: KeyType
nested_items.description: The type of key that is used for the encryption. If no keyType is provided, the service will use the default setting (static-key).

nested_items.name: Region
nested_items.description: The Amazon Web Services Region that the API Gateway proxy endpoint was created in. This parameter is required for SPEKE encryption and is not valid for static key encryption.

nested_items.name: ResourceId
nested_items.description: An identifier for the content. The service sends this value to the key server to identify the current endpoint. The resource ID is also known as the content ID. This parameter is required for SPEKE encryption and is not valid for static key encryption.

nested_items.name: RoleArn
nested_items.description: The ARN of the role that you created during setup (when you set up MediaConnect as a trusted entity).

nested_items.name: SecretArn
nested_items.description: The ARN of the secret that you created in Secrets Manager to store the encryption key. This parameter is required for static key encryption and is not valid for SPEKE encryption.

nested_items.name: Url
nested_items.description: The URL from the API Gateway proxy that you set up to talk to your key server. This parameter is required for SPEKE encryption and is not valid for static key encryption.

nested_items.name: Description
nested_items.description: A description for the source. This value is not used or seen outside of the current MediaConnect account.

nested_items.name: EntitlementArn
nested_items.description: The ARN of the entitlement that allows you to subscribe to content that comes from another Amazon Web Services account. The entitlement is set by the content originator and the ARN is generated as part of the originator's flow.

nested_items.name: IngestIp
nested_items.description: The IP address that the flow will be listening on for incoming content.

nested_items.name: IngestPort
nested_items.description: The port that the flow will be listening on for incoming content.

nested_items.name: MediaStreamSourceConfigurations
nested_items.description: The media streams that are associated with the source, and the parameters for those associations.

nested_items.name: EncodingName
nested_items.description: The format that was used to encode the data. For ancillary data streams, set the encoding name to smpte291. For audio streams, set the encoding name to pcm. For video, 2110 streams, set the encoding name to raw. For video, JPEG XS streams, set the encoding name to jxsv.

nested_items.name: InputConfigurations
nested_items.description: The media streams that you want to associate with the source.

nested_items.name: InputIp
nested_items.description: The IP address that the flow listens on for incoming content for a media stream.

nested_items.name: InputPort
nested_items.description: The port that the flow listens on for an incoming media stream.

nested_items.name: Interface
nested_items.description: The VPC interface where the media stream comes in from.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The name of the VPC interface.

nested_items.name: MediaStreamName
nested_items.description: A name that helps you distinguish one media stream from another.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The name of the source.

nested_items.name: SenderControlPort
nested_items.description: The IP address that the flow communicates with to initiate connection with the sender.

nested_items.name: SenderIpAddress
nested_items.description: The port that the flow uses to send outbound requests to initiate connection with the sender.

nested_items.name: SourceArn
nested_items.description: The ARN of the source.

nested_items.name: Transport
nested_items.description: Attributes related to the transport stream that are used in the source.

nested_items.name: CidrAllowList
nested_items.description: The range of IP addresses that should be allowed to initiate output requests to this flow. These IP addresses should be in the form of a Classless Inter-Domain Routing (CIDR) block; for example, 10.0.0.0/16
(string) ---

nested_items.name: MaxBitrate
nested_items.description: The smoothing max bitrate (in bps) for RIST, RTP, and RTP-FEC streams.

nested_items.name: MaxLatency
nested_items.description: The maximum latency in milliseconds. This parameter applies only to RIST-based and Zixi-based streams.

nested_items.name: MaxSyncBuffer
nested_items.description: The size of the buffer (in milliseconds) to use to sync incoming source data.

nested_items.name: MinLatency
nested_items.description: The minimum latency in milliseconds for SRT-based streams. In streams that use the SRT protocol, this value that you set on your MediaConnect source or output represents the minimal potential latency of that connection. The latency of the stream is set to the highest number between the sender's minimum latency and the receiver's minimum latency.

nested_items.name: Protocol
nested_items.description: The protocol that is used by the source or output.

nested_items.name: RemoteId
nested_items.description: The remote ID for the Zixi-pull stream.

nested_items.name: SenderControlPort
nested_items.description: The port that the flow uses to send outbound requests to initiate connection with the sender.

nested_items.name: SenderIpAddress
nested_items.description: The IP address that the flow communicates with to initiate connection with the sender.

nested_items.name: SmoothingLatency
nested_items.description: The smoothing latency in milliseconds for RIST, RTP, and RTP-FEC streams.

nested_items.name: SourceListenerAddress
nested_items.description: Source IP or domain name for SRT-caller protocol.

nested_items.name: SourceListenerPort
nested_items.description: Source port for SRT-caller protocol.

nested_items.name: StreamId
nested_items.description: The stream ID that you want to use for this transport. This parameter applies only to Zixi and SRT caller-based streams.

nested_items.name: NdiSpeedHqQuality
nested_items.description: A quality setting for the NDI Speed HQ encoder.

nested_items.name: NdiProgramName
nested_items.description: A suffix for the names of the NDI sources that the flow creates. If a custom name isn't specified, MediaConnect uses the output name.

nested_items.name: VpcInterfaceName
nested_items.description: The name of the VPC interface that is used for this source.

nested_items.name: WhitelistCidr
nested_items.description: The range of IP addresses that should be allowed to contribute content to your source. These IP addresses should be in the form of a Classless Inter-Domain Routing (CIDR) block; for example, 10.0.0.0/16.

nested_items.name: GatewayBridgeSource
nested_items.description: The source configuration for cloud flows receiving a stream from a bridge.

nested_items.name: BridgeArn
nested_items.description: The ARN of the bridge feeding this flow.

nested_items.name: VpcInterfaceAttachment
nested_items.description: The name of the VPC interface attachment to use for this bridge source.

nested_items.name: VpcInterfaceName
nested_items.description: The name of the VPC interface to use for this resource.

nested_items.name: PeerIpAddress
nested_items.description: The IP address of the device that is currently sending content to this source.

nested_items.name: SourceFailoverConfig
nested_items.description: The settings for the source failover.

nested_items.name: FailoverMode
nested_items.description: The type of failover you choose for this flow. MERGE combines the source streams into a single stream, allowing graceful recovery from any single-source loss. FAILOVER allows switching between different streams.

nested_items.name: RecoveryWindow
nested_items.description: Search window time to look for dash-7 packets.

nested_items.name: SourcePriority
nested_items.description: The priority you want to assign to a source. You can have a primary stream and a backup stream or two equally prioritized streams.

nested_items.name: PrimarySource
nested_items.description: The name of the source you choose as the primary source for this flow.

nested_items.name: State
nested_items.description: The state of source failover on the flow. If the state is inactive, the flow can have only one source. If the state is active, the flow can have one or two sources.

nested_items.name: Sources
nested_items.description: The settings for the sources that are assigned to the flow.

nested_items.name: DataTransferSubscriberFeePercent
nested_items.description: Percentage from 0-100 of the data transfer cost to be billed to the subscriber.

nested_items.name: Decryption
nested_items.description: The type of encryption that is used on the content ingested from this source.

nested_items.name: Algorithm
nested_items.description: The type of algorithm that is used for the encryption (such as aes128, aes192, or aes256).

nested_items.name: ConstantInitializationVector
nested_items.description: A 128-bit, 16-byte hex value represented by a 32-character string, to be used with the key for encrypting content. This parameter is not valid for static key encryption.

nested_items.name: DeviceId
nested_items.description: The value of one of the devices that you configured with your digital rights management (DRM) platform key provider. This parameter is required for SPEKE encryption and is not valid for static key encryption.

nested_items.name: KeyType
nested_items.description: The type of key that is used for the encryption. If no keyType is provided, the service will use the default setting (static-key).

nested_items.name: Region
nested_items.description: The Amazon Web Services Region that the API Gateway proxy endpoint was created in. This parameter is required for SPEKE encryption and is not valid for static key encryption.

nested_items.name: ResourceId
nested_items.description: An identifier for the content. The service sends this value to the key server to identify the current endpoint. The resource ID is also known as the content ID. This parameter is required for SPEKE encryption and is not valid for static key encryption.

nested_items.name: RoleArn
nested_items.description: The ARN of the role that you created during setup (when you set up MediaConnect as a trusted entity).

nested_items.name: SecretArn
nested_items.description: The ARN of the secret that you created in Secrets Manager to store the encryption key. This parameter is required for static key encryption and is not valid for SPEKE encryption.

nested_items.name: Url
nested_items.description: The URL from the API Gateway proxy that you set up to talk to your key server. This parameter is required for SPEKE encryption and is not valid for static key encryption.

nested_items.name: Description
nested_items.description: A description for the source. This value is not used or seen outside of the current MediaConnect account.

nested_items.name: EntitlementArn
nested_items.description: The ARN of the entitlement that allows you to subscribe to content that comes from another Amazon Web Services account. The entitlement is set by the content originator and the ARN is generated as part of the originator's flow.

nested_items.name: IngestIp
nested_items.description: The IP address that the flow will be listening on for incoming content.

nested_items.name: IngestPort
nested_items.description: The port that the flow will be listening on for incoming content.

nested_items.name: MediaStreamSourceConfigurations
nested_items.description: The media streams that are associated with the source, and the parameters for those associations.

nested_items.name: EncodingName
nested_items.description: The format that was used to encode the data. For ancillary data streams, set the encoding name to smpte291. For audio streams, set the encoding name to pcm. For video, 2110 streams, set the encoding name to raw. For video, JPEG XS streams, set the encoding name to jxsv.

nested_items.name: InputConfigurations
nested_items.description: The media streams that you want to associate with the source.

nested_items.name: InputIp
nested_items.description: The IP address that the flow listens on for incoming content for a media stream.

nested_items.name: InputPort
nested_items.description: The port that the flow listens on for an incoming media stream.

nested_items.name: Interface
nested_items.description: The VPC interface where the media stream comes in from.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The name of the VPC interface.

nested_items.name: MediaStreamName
nested_items.description: A name that helps you distinguish one media stream from another.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The name of the source.

nested_items.name: SenderControlPort
nested_items.description: The IP address that the flow communicates with to initiate connection with the sender.

nested_items.name: SenderIpAddress
nested_items.description: The port that the flow uses to send outbound requests to initiate connection with the sender.

nested_items.name: SourceArn
nested_items.description: The ARN of the source.

nested_items.name: Transport
nested_items.description: Attributes related to the transport stream that are used in the source.

nested_items.name: CidrAllowList
nested_items.description: The range of IP addresses that should be allowed to initiate output requests to this flow. These IP addresses should be in the form of a Classless Inter-Domain Routing (CIDR) block; for example, 10.0.0.0/16
(string) ---

nested_items.name: MaxBitrate
nested_items.description: The smoothing max bitrate (in bps) for RIST, RTP, and RTP-FEC streams.

nested_items.name: MaxLatency
nested_items.description: The maximum latency in milliseconds. This parameter applies only to RIST-based and Zixi-based streams.

nested_items.name: MaxSyncBuffer
nested_items.description: The size of the buffer (in milliseconds) to use to sync incoming source data.

nested_items.name: MinLatency
nested_items.description: The minimum latency in milliseconds for SRT-based streams. In streams that use the SRT protocol, this value that you set on your MediaConnect source or output represents the minimal potential latency of that connection. The latency of the stream is set to the highest number between the sender's minimum latency and the receiver's minimum latency.

nested_items.name: Protocol
nested_items.description: The protocol that is used by the source or output.

nested_items.name: RemoteId
nested_items.description: The remote ID for the Zixi-pull stream.

nested_items.name: SenderControlPort
nested_items.description: The port that the flow uses to send outbound requests to initiate connection with the sender.

nested_items.name: SenderIpAddress
nested_items.description: The IP address that the flow communicates with to initiate connection with the sender.

nested_items.name: SmoothingLatency
nested_items.description: The smoothing latency in milliseconds for RIST, RTP, and RTP-FEC streams.

nested_items.name: SourceListenerAddress
nested_items.description: Source IP or domain name for SRT-caller protocol.

nested_items.name: SourceListenerPort
nested_items.description: Source port for SRT-caller protocol.

nested_items.name: StreamId
nested_items.description: The stream ID that you want to use for this transport. This parameter applies only to Zixi and SRT caller-based streams.

nested_items.name: NdiSpeedHqQuality
nested_items.description: A quality setting for the NDI Speed HQ encoder.

nested_items.name: NdiProgramName
nested_items.description: A suffix for the names of the NDI sources that the flow creates. If a custom name isn't specified, MediaConnect uses the output name.

nested_items.name: VpcInterfaceName
nested_items.description: The name of the VPC interface that is used for this source.

nested_items.name: WhitelistCidr
nested_items.description: The range of IP addresses that should be allowed to contribute content to your source. These IP addresses should be in the form of a Classless Inter-Domain Routing (CIDR) block; for example, 10.0.0.0/16.

nested_items.name: GatewayBridgeSource
nested_items.description: The source configuration for cloud flows receiving a stream from a bridge.

nested_items.name: BridgeArn
nested_items.description: The ARN of the bridge feeding this flow.

nested_items.name: VpcInterfaceAttachment
nested_items.description: The name of the VPC interface attachment to use for this bridge source.

nested_items.name: VpcInterfaceName
nested_items.description: The name of the VPC interface to use for this resource.

nested_items.name: PeerIpAddress
nested_items.description: The IP address of the device that is currently sending content to this source.

nested_items.name: Status
nested_items.description: The current status of the flow.

nested_items.name: VpcInterfaces
nested_items.description: The VPC Interfaces for this flow.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: Immutable and has to be a unique against other VpcInterfaces in this Flow.

nested_items.name: NetworkInterfaceIds
nested_items.description: IDs of the network interfaces created in customer's account by MediaConnect.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: NetworkInterfaceType
nested_items.description: The type of network interface.

nested_items.name: RoleArn
nested_items.description: A role Arn MediaConnect can assume to create ENIs in your account.

nested_items.name: SecurityGroupIds
nested_items.description: Security Group IDs to be used on ENI.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: SubnetId
nested_items.description: Subnet must be in the AZ of the Flow.

nested_items.name: Maintenance
nested_items.description: The maintenance settings for the flow.

nested_items.name: MaintenanceDay
nested_items.description: A day of a week when the maintenance will happen. Use Monday/Tuesday/Wednesday/Thursday/Friday/Saturday/Sunday.

nested_items.name: MaintenanceDeadline
nested_items.description: The Maintenance has to be performed before this deadline in ISO UTC format. Example: 2021-01-30T08:30:00Z.

nested_items.name: MaintenanceScheduledDate
nested_items.description: A scheduled date in ISO UTC format when the maintenance will happen. Use YYYY-MM-DD format. Example: 2021-01-30.

nested_items.name: MaintenanceStartHour
nested_items.description: UTC time when the maintenance will happen. Use 24-hour HH:MM format. Minutes must be 00. Example: 13:00. The default value is 02:00.

nested_items.name: SourceMonitoringConfig
nested_items.description: The settings for source monitoring.

nested_items.name: ThumbnailState
nested_items.description: Indicates whether thumbnails are enabled or disabled.

nested_items.name: AudioMonitoringSettings
nested_items.description: Contains the settings for audio stream metrics monitoring.

nested_items.name: SilentAudio
nested_items.description: Detects periods of silence.

nested_items.name: State
nested_items.description: Indicates whether the SilentAudio metric is enabled or disabled.

nested_items.name: ThresholdSeconds
nested_items.description: Specifies the number of consecutive seconds of silence that triggers an event or alert.

nested_items.name: ContentQualityAnalysisState
nested_items.description: Indicates whether content quality analysis is enabled or disabled.

nested_items.name: VideoMonitoringSettings
nested_items.description: Contains the settings for video stream metrics monitoring.

nested_items.name: BlackFrames
nested_items.description: Detects video frames that are black.

nested_items.name: State
nested_items.description: Indicates whether the BlackFrames metric is enabled or disabled..

nested_items.name: ThresholdSeconds
nested_items.description: Specifies the number of consecutive seconds of black frames that triggers an event or alert.

nested_items.name: FrozenFrames
nested_items.description: Detects video frames that have not changed.

nested_items.name: State
nested_items.description: Indicates whether the FrozenFrames metric is enabled or disabled.

nested_items.name: ThresholdSeconds
nested_items.description: Specifies the number of consecutive seconds of a static image that triggers an event or alert.

nested_items.name: FlowSize
nested_items.description: Determines the processing capacity and feature set of the flow. Set this optional parameter to LARGE if you want to enable NDI outputs on the flow.

nested_items.name: NdiConfig
nested_items.description: Specifies the configuration settings for NDI outputs. Required when the flow includes NDI outputs.

nested_items.name: NdiState
nested_items.description: A setting that controls whether NDI outputs can be used in the flow. Must be ENABLED to add NDI outputs. Default is DISABLED.

nested_items.name: MachineName
nested_items.description: A prefix for the names of the NDI sources that the flow creates. If a custom name isn't specified, MediaConnect generates a unique 12-character ID as the prefix.

nested_items.name: NdiDiscoveryServers
nested_items.description: A list of up to three NDI discovery server configurations. While not required by the API, this configuration is necessary for NDI functionality to work properly.

nested_items.name: DiscoveryServerAddress
nested_items.description: The unique network address of the NDI discovery server.

nested_items.name: DiscoveryServerPort
nested_items.description: The port for the NDI discovery server. Defaults to 5959 if a custom port isn't specified.

nested_items.name: VpcInterfaceAdapter
nested_items.description: The identifier for the Virtual Private Cloud (VPC) network interface used by the flow.
